page.title: 08VILLAGE HALL ACTIVITIES
page.content: When Aston Somerville school closed in 1969 the building was given to the village under the trusteeship of the Parochial Church Council. It became the village hall and is used for social occasions such as harvest suppers, barbecues and discos. It is also used for meetings including Parish Council Meetings. A play group for under 5's, the Womens Institute and Youth Club use the hall regularly. Youth Club members age 10+ enjoy snooker, table tennis and darts among other activities. The Village Show held in the hall displays villagers interests with fine examples of painting, embroidery, knitting, cookery, garden produce and flowers with awards given to the best in each class. At present the hall is being extended to provide indoor toilet facilities.
